member.name: T:POS.My.MyWpfExtension
member.summary: Module used to define the properties that are available in the My Namespace for WPF

member.name: P:POS.My.MyWpfExtension.Application
member.summary: Returns the application object for the running application

member.name: P:POS.My.MyWpfExtension.Computer
member.summary: Returns information about the host computer.

member.name: P:POS.My.MyWpfExtension.User
member.summary: Returns information for the current user. If you wish to run the application with the current Windows user credentials, call My.User.InitializeWithWindowsUser().

member.name: P:POS.My.MyWpfExtension.Log
member.summary: Returns the application log. The listeners can be configured by the application's configuration file.

member.name: P:POS.My.MyWpfExtension.Windows
member.summary: Returns the collection of Windows defined in the project.

member.name: T:POS.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:POS.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:POS.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:POS.POSApp
member.summary:
To Do Front End: Display totals in a nicer way. Probably a dataTemplate like in lstBoxTicket Make sperate tabs for item categories
To Do Backend: Hook up to the correct database Send orders to database Should probably make an order object
Other Notes: lstSelectedItems might not need to exist, I'm not sure. We might just want to use lstBoxTicket.Items The logic for the event handlers on MainWindow should be in POSApp. Extra Functionality - Make it store menu in XML so that it can run without db connection.
